CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 31, 1956, pg. 27, reads: "Final Tribute - Pallbearers of two racial groups are shown lifting remains of the late William (Big Brownie) Brown into funeral car for burial last Saturday. Left to right: Sydney Lewis, Wilbert Darling, Melvin Thomas, Jacob Darling, William (Wuggie) [sic] Harris and Leonard Edelson.  Wilbert Darling and Leonard Edelson are owners of Hill Pharmacy, which was closed three hours on Saturday afternoon out of respect for their departed friend.  Jacob Darling is the father of Wilbert. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Pallbearers Sydney Lewis, Wilbert Darling, Melvin Thomas, Jacob Darling, William "Woogie" Harris second from right, and Leonard Edelson on right, carrying flag draped casket of William "Big Brownie" Brown, to hearse, outside of West's Funeral Home, with Ervaline's Grill and Lew's Loan Office next door, 2200 block of Centre Avenue, Hill District
